contract.title: Independent Contractor Services Agreement
contract.term: One (1) year from the Effective Date

party1.name: Cascade Digital Agency, LLC
party1.address:
1847 Market Street, Suite 400
San Francisco, CA 94103

recitals: WHEREAS, Client is engaged in the business of providing digital marketing and web development services to its customers;
WHEREAS, Contractor possesses specialized skills and expertise in software development, specifically in React, Node.js, and cloud infrastructure;
WHEREAS, Client desires to engage Contractor to provide certain development services, and Contractor desires to provide such services, on the terms and conditions set forth herein.

sections.title: Services
sections.content: Contractor agrees to provide the following services to Client (the "Services"):

subsections.content: Full-stack web development using React, Next.js, and Node.js technologies
Cloud infrastructure setup and maintenance on AWS and Vercel platforms
Code review and technical consultation for Client's development team
Such other development services as may be mutually agreed upon in writing by the parties

sections.title: Term and Termination
sections.content: This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for the Term specified above, unless earlier terminated as provided herein.

subsections.title: Termination for Convenience
subsections.content: Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the other party.

subsections.title: Termination for Cause
subsections.content: Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other party materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within fifteen (15) days after receiving written notice thereof.

sections.title: Compensation
sections.content: Client shall compensate Contractor for Services rendered as follows:

subsections.content: Contractor shall be paid at a rate of One Hundred Fifty Dollars ($150.00) per hour for all Services rendered.
Contractor shall submit invoices bi-weekly for hours worked during the preceding period. Payment shall be due within fifteen (15) days of invoice receipt.
Contractor shall be reimbursed for pre-approved, reasonable business expenses incurred in connection with the Services, provided Contractor submits appropriate documentation.

sections.title: Independent Contractor Status
sections.content: Contractor is an independent contractor and not an employee, partner, or joint venturer of Client. Contractor shall be solely responsible for all taxes, withholdings, and other statutory obligations. Contractor shall not be entitled to any employee benefits from Client, including but not limited to health insurance, retirement benefits, or paid time off.

sections.title: Intellectual Property
sections.content: All work product, deliverables, and materials created by Contractor in the performance of Services ("Work Product") shall be the sole and exclusive property of Client. Contractor hereby assigns to Client all right, title, and interest in and to the Work Product, including all intellectual property rights therein.

subsections.content: Contractor retains the right to use general knowledge, skills, and experience gained during the engagement, as well as any pre-existing tools, libraries, or frameworks owned by Contractor ("Contractor Tools"), provided such Contractor Tools are identified in Exhibit A.

sections.title: Confidentiality
sections.content: Contractor agrees to hold in strict confidence all Confidential Information of Client. "Confidential Information" means any non-public information disclosed by Client, including but not limited to business plans, customer lists, technical data, and financial information. Contractor shall not disclose or use any Confidential Information except as necessary to perform the Services.

subsections.content: The obligations of confidentiality shall survive the termination of this Agreement for a period of three (3) years.

sections.title: Representations and Warranties
sections.content: Contractor represents and warrants that: (a) Contractor has the right to enter into this Agreement; (b) the Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner; (c) the Work Product will be original and will not infringe upon any third-party rights.

sections.title: Limitation of Liability
sections.content: IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, REGARDLESS OF THE CAUSE OF ACTION OR WHETHER SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. CLIENT'S TOTAL LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNTS PAID TO CONTRACTOR IN THE SIX (6) MONTHS PRECEDING THE CLAIM.

subsections.title: Entire Agreement
subsections.content: This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior negotiations, understandings, and agreements.

subsections.title: Amendment
subsections.content: This Agreement may not be modified except by a written instrument signed by both parties.

subsections.title: Governing Law
subsections.content: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California, without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

subsections.title: Notices
subsections.content: All notices shall be in writing and delivered to the addresses set forth above, or to such other address as either party may designate in writing.

forCause: Material breach not cured within 15 days of notice
Failure to perform Services to professional standards
termination.forConvenience: Either party may terminate with 30 days written notice
effects: Payment for all Services rendered through termination date
Return of all Client materials and Confidential Information
Survival of confidentiality and IP provisions

exhibits.title: Contractor Tools and Pre-Existing IP
exhibits.description: List of tools, libraries, and frameworks owned by Contractor that may be used in performing Services

exhibits.title: Initial Project Scope
exhibits.description: Description of initial projects and estimated timelines

signatures.signatureText: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date.
